DevOps Reading List

Many of these readings long pre-date the creation (in 2008) of the term DevOps. But the DevOps movement does not pretend to have sprung, like Athena, fully-formed from the head of Zeus. All of the leading DevOps figures explicitly acknowledge their great debt to the many brilliant figures who laid the foundations for what we today call DevOps, which consists in the merging of many earlier streams of thought on how to develop software and manage its deployment and operations.

  • A Pattern Language, Christopher Alexander
    Reviewer(s):
  • Antifragile, Nassim Nicholas Taleb
    Reviewer(s):
  • Continuous Delivery, Jez Humble and David Farley
    Reviewer(s): Sneha Ghosh, Ravish Bhatia
    Our review
  • DevOps Case Studies, The IT Revolution
    Reviewer(s):
  • Docker Up and Running, Karl Matthias and Sean P. Kane
    Reviewer(s):
  • Domain-Driven Design, Eric Evans
    Reviewer(s):
  • Effective DevOps, Jennifer Davis and Katherine Daniels
    Reviewer(s):
  • Implementing Lean Software Development, Mary and Tom Poppendieck, Jeff Sutherland, and Kent Beck
    Reviewer(s): Chaoqun Huang, Qiwei Zhou
  • Infrastructure as Code: Managing Servers in the Cloud, Kief Morris
    Reviewer(s): Adit Kumar, Shivraj
    Our review
  • Just-in-Time for Today and Tomorrow, Taiichi Ohno and Setsuo Mito
    Reviewer(s):
  • Kubernetes Up and Running, Kelsey Hightower, Brendan Burns, and Joe Beda
    Reviewer(s): Sneha Ghosh, Ravish Bhatia
    Our review
  • Leading the Transformation: Applying Agile and DevOps Principles at Scale, Gary Gruver and Tommy Mouser
    Reviewer(s):
  • Lean Software Development: An Agile Toolkit, Mary and Tom Poppendieck
    Reviewer(s): Jiawei Wang, Bowei Xu
    Our review
  • Making Work Visible, Dominica DeGrandis
    Reviewer(s): Akshay Hazare
    Our review

    Reviewer(s): Lili Xu, Yang Lou
    Our review

    Reviewer(s): Tingjun Zhang
    Our review
